flashcards.english: A tree is straightened when young (Good manners and discipline should be instilled in children when they are young)
flashcards.notes: Child-rearing wisdom: Do not wait till your kids are adults. Vocabulary: Mũtĩ (tree), Kũrũnga (to correct/make straight), Mũnini (small/young), Taara (give advice). Context example: Ndegwa nĩ anyitwo nĩ borithi (Ndegwa has been arrested by police) - Nĩ kĩĩ eka? (What has he done?) - Nĩ kũĩya mbeca (It's stealing money) - Mũtĩ ũrũngagwo ũrĩ mũnini (A tree is straightened when young)
